definition: to be confused/to be at a loss/Taiwan pr. [fa1 meng2]
(old) to instruct the young/to teach a child to read and write/as easy as ABC
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to deceive/to cheat/to hoodwink/to make a wild guess
Mongol ethnic group/abbr. for Mongolia 蒙古國|蒙古国[Meng3 gu3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Meng2]
to cover/ignorant/to suffer (misfortune)/to receive (a favor)/to cheat

sentences.english: He sat now not even trying to read, his mind a blank.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在那里头脑发蒙，不再装着看书了。

sentences.english: I got into a muddle when he asked me the question.
sentences.chinese: 当他问我这个问题时，我还真有写发蒙。

sentences.english: One day Iwent to see my first teacher, but he happened to be out.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，我去看我的发蒙老师，可碰巧他出去了。

definition: to feel dizzy/to be confused/to be at a loss/to stare blankly/Taiwan pr. [fa1 meng2]
to not know the reason/to not know what to do
variant of 發怵|发怵[fa1 chu4]
not knowing what to do (idiom); at one's wits' end/embarrassed and at a complete loss
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
